---
title: XDR
order: 6
---

import { ExampleResponse } from "components/ExampleResponse";
import { NestedTable } from "components/NestedTable";

In the Stellar network, transactions are encoded using a standardized protocol called [External Data Representation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/External_Data_Representation) (XDR).

In Horizon, you will only encounter XDR when [posting](../resources/transactions/post-transaction.mdx) and [getting](../resources/transactions/retrieve-transaction.mdx) transactions and in the [ledger](../resources/ledgers/retrieve-ledger.mdx) header.

When you post a transaction, a client will encode the transaction as XDR before submitting it to Horizon.

When you request a transaction, Horizon returns some data about the transaction in human-readable JSON. The full canonical data about the transaction is encoded in machine-readable XDR, available in XDR attributes at the end of the response.

You can decode this XDR in the Stellar Laboratoryâ€™s [XDR Viewer](https://www.stellar.org/laboratory#xdr-viewer).

<NestedTable>

- ATTRIBUTE
  - TYPE
  - DESCRIPTION
- envelope_xdr
  - string
  - The XDR encoded transaction as stellar-core sees it.
- result_xdr
  - string
  - The effects of a transaction encoded in XDR.
- result_meta_xdr
  - string
  - The details about the effects of a transaction encoded in XDR.
- fee_meta_xdr
  - string
  - The fees associated with the transaction encoded in XDR.

</NestedTable>

<ExampleResponse title="Example Transaction Response with XDR">

```json
{
  // Response truncated to highlight XDR-related attributes
  "envelope_xdr": "",
  "result_xdr": "AAAAAAAAAMgAAAAAAAAAAgAAAAAAAAAGAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAFAAAAAAAAAAA=",
  "result_meta_xdr": "",
  "fee_meta_xdr": ""
  // Response truncated to highlight XDR-related attributes
}
```

</ExampleResponse>
